node.title: Warehouse manager wanted in theft of $1 million worth of COVID-19 tests
node.description: Carlitos Peralta, 33, allegedly sent nearly 100 shipments of COVID tests to his home.
node.content: ["Police are looking for a California warehouse manager who is accused of stealing more than $1 million worth of COVID-19 tests from his employer.", "Carlitos Peralta, 33, was the manager of a Covid Clinic warehouse in Santa Ana. He had access to the company's shipping and delivery system and sent nearly 100 shipments of COVID tests to his home from multiple warehouses, according to\u00a0Santa Ana police. The tests have an estimated value of $1,000,575, police said.", "#SantaAnaPD #WantedWednesday - February 23, 2022 https://t.co/p7ZMSl7fAZ", "The company owns seven warehouses nationwide, and each one stores and ships COVID tests to clinics, pop-up testing sites, schools and hotels, police said.", "Anyone with information about Peralta or his whereabouts is asked to contact Santa Ana Police Detective Rashad Wilson at 714-254-8551 or via email at\u00a0rashadwilson@santa-ana.org.", "This story first appeared on CBS Los Angeles."]
